meta_description: Woolaroc was the ranch retreat of oilman Frank Phillips and is now a 3,700-acre wildlife preserve and world-class art museum. Featuring everything from Native American artifacts to scenic outdoor nature trails, Woolaroc has something for everyone!
hours_text:
## Hours & Admission

###  HOURS 

  * **Regular Hours:**  
Open Wed-Sun, 10am-5pm

  * **Summer Hours (Memorial Day – Labor Day):**  
Open Tue-Sun, 10am-5pm

  * **Holidays (All grounds and facilities):**  
Open Memorial Day, July 4th, Labor Day, and New Year’s Day  
Closed Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day

  * **Mountain Man Camp:**  
Open March 18 – May 25, Wed-Sun, 10am-4:30pm  
Open May 26 – Sept 7, Tue-Sun, 10am-4:30pm

  * **Animal Barn:**  
Open March 18 – May 25, Wed-Sun, 10am-5pm  
Open May 26 – Sept 7, Tue-Sun, 10am-5pm  
Open Sept 8 – Dec 20, Weekends Only 10am-5pm  
Closed Dec 21 – Spring 2027

###  ADMISSION 

  * Adults – $19
  * Military Discount – $17
  * Over 65 – $17
  * Children 12 and younger, and Members of Woolaroc are FREE

[BUY GUEST PASSES](/tickets/)

## COME EXPLORE WOOLAROC

Hidden away in the rugged Osage Hills, Woolaroc was once the ranch retreat of oilman Frank Phillips. Now, it serves as a historic property open for visitors to enjoy. This includes but is not limited to: a 3,700-acre wildlife preserve, world-class museum, historic lodge, animal barn, hiking trails, and so much more! Come and see why Will Rogers called it “the most unique place in this country.”

[](/group-tours/)

###  [GROUP TOURS](/group-tours/)

With our expansive property, we are the perfect choice for large groups! Partner with our friendly team to ensure your group has a memorable experience—one they will be talking about for many months to come.
